{{cpp/title|isgraph{{small|(std::locale)}}}}
{{cpp/locale/navbar}}
{{ddcl|header=locale|
template&lt; class CharT &gt;
bool isgraph( CharT ch, const locale&amp; loc );
}}

Checks if the given character is classified as a graphic character (i.e. printable, excluding space) by the given locale's {{lc|std::ctype}} facet.

===Parameters===
{{par begin}}
{{par|ch|character}}
{{par|loc|locale}}
{{par end}}

===Return value===
Returns {{c|true}} if the character is classified as graphic, {{c|false}} otherwise.

===Possible implementation===
{{eq fun
|1=
template&lt;class CharT&gt;
bool isgraph(CharT ch, const std::locale&amp; loc)
{
    return std::use_facet&lt;std::ctype&lt;CharT&gt;&gt;(loc).is(std::ctype_base::graph, ch);
}
}}

===Example===
{{example
|Demonstrates the use of {{tt|isgraph()}} with different locales (OS-specific).
|code=
#include &lt;iostream&gt;
#include &lt;locale&gt;

int main()
{
    const wchar_t c = L'\u2a0c'; // quadruple integral

    std::locale loc1("C");
    std::cout &lt;&lt; "isgraph('⨌', C locale) returned "
              &lt;&lt; std::boolalpha &lt;&lt; std::isgraph(c, loc1) &lt;&lt; '\n';

    std::locale loc2("en_US.UTF-8");
    std::cout &lt;&lt; "isgraph('⨌', Unicode locale) returned "
              &lt;&lt; std::boolalpha &lt;&lt; std::isgraph(c, loc2) &lt;&lt; '\n';
}
|p=true
|output=
isgraph('⨌', C locale) returned false
isgraph('⨌', Unicode locale) returned true
}}
